channel.title: Less is better comments on Synergy!

item.title: "Synergy!": comment by John Lam
item.description: Nope – no problems at all bringing my Powerbook in and out of suspend. I find that with my Toshiba and my Powerbook, if I use them away from my network and bring them back that everything “just works” provided that I keep the synergy client software running while away from my network.

item.title: "Synergy!": comment by Scott Hanselman
item.description:
Phooey on you! Ya, I’m loving Synergy, I use it to talk to my Mac Mini.

Have you had trouble with them losing connection when the Mac falls asleep? This has kept me from running the Mac headless.

item.title: "Synergy!": comment by John Lam
item.description: So far I’ve had no problems whatsoever with Synergy. Perhaps you’re using an older build? I regularly detach my PowerBook and my Tablet PC from this configuration and when they come back, everything continues to work just fine. I’ll be on the lookout for problems, though.

item.title: "Synergy!": comment by Dan Dunham
item.description: I love the idea of Synergy, and when it worked it was great (I have a dual-monitor main machine, one secondary machine, and a laptop using it at work). However, roughly once a day I have to kill all of them when it gets completely hosed and messes up the state of Shift, Alt, or Windows-key on one of the workstations (typing quickly becomes un-fun). It’s paticularly bad about handling when some of the desktops go into locked mode, or losing the mouse cursor completely.

item.title: "Synergy!" by jlam
item.description:
While looking for other people who have actually used SOAP to access the Flickr API, I discovered Synergy.

My life’s dream is complete: I have actually discovered a useful utility before Scott Hanselman! Marvel at how I can use the same keyboard and mouse on the same virtual desktop across three computers, one of which is my Powerbook!

All I have to do is roll the mouse to the desired screen, and the keyboard “focus” follows my mouse. Absolutely fantastic utility.
